page.title: 15FARMING SAMPLE STUDIES
page.content: Cont.from page 14 of the barley are bought by animal feed merchants such as James Burnhill at Cleckheaton.Two thirds of the farmer's income comes from crops. The farmer has a beef herd,43 of which are cows and heifers in calf,3 are bulls and the rest are young animals.The bulls are pedigree Hereford bulls and the rest of the cattle are cross-bred Hereford Friesians and Hereford Charolais.The cattle are kept out in the fields for most of the year and inside during the winter.While outside,they are fed on grass,hay,straw,potatoes,and compound food.In the winter they are fed on the last four things.All the cattle are born on the farm except the bulls which are bought young from York Cattle Market.The cattle that the farmer sells are sold at between 10
